title: What is something an older person in your life struggles with when it comes to technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: My father-in-law decided not to get his house connected to the Internet and made the choice to give up his landline as a result (all of Australia is basically being forced into connecting to the “NBN” - Nobbled Bulldust Notwork as I call it - for both Internet and phone connections). He can’t see that his children and (in particular) grandchildren who will be left with the house will suffer reduced usability and potential selling price as a result. We’ll leave aside the fact that he’s also had the house Heritage listed, so selling it is even less possible now. Now that he has no landline, he’s reliant on his mobile. He’s in the habit of only ever turning it on if he needs to use it. Don’t bother trying to send a text message, though: He never reads them.

Maybe you just don’t have a clue. We have never been introduced to it In our lives. You all have. You have been prepped for it. But us old folks have never been, then, wham, suddenly our whole worlds have changed. We can’t be as savvy or up on things, we try just to make a phone call or text. This is why we need you all, to HELP us.hehe
